davis land
about / links / samples / contact / blog


Hi! My name is Davis Land.

I'm a student at Texas A&M University, studying Telecommunications and Media Studies.

I like to make stuff.

Currently I'm an intern at WBUR Boston in the newsroom. I help write and interview for the hourly newscast and often join producers out in the field.

I was formerly an intern at Transom.org in Woods Hole, MA. At Transom I got my first taste of producing things for the public media worldâ€”over the summer I had a total of three stories air on WCAI, the local NPR affiliate. Thinking back, it was a trememdous oppurtunity and I definitely didn't realize how awesome it was to be with those folks. Transom will always hold a special place in my heart.

Currently I serve as the Editor-In-Chief for two publications: The Eckleburg Project, which is A&M's student-run literary journal, and Alien Mouth, an independent journal and press I started with a friend.

I work for the Texas A&M University Writing Center where I produce a podcast called Write Right which will be launching soon. I've also served as the Programming Director for KANM Student Radio for a good while now, while djing and volunteering at KEOS Community Radio. I also produce a podcast for Write About Now Poetry, which is in its third season of production.

I've gained a lot of different skills through making stuff; here's an incomplete list: audio and video editing, web design and computer programming, how to do writing good, emailing (it's a skill, trust me), being funny sometimes, Twitter (that's also a skill I think), book binding, the entire Adobe Creative Cloud suite, cooking, having a critical eye, driving in Boston, paying off a credit card, being a leader, the Do Not Disturb feature on my phone, tying shoes, high fiving, being a direct communicator, and a few more things.
